It's questionable here... ``` ::: # default printing style of a table Let's consider our table from last class: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} penguins %>% group_by(species) %>% summarise(average_bill_lenth = mean(bill_length_mm), average_bill_depth = mean(bill_depth_mm)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 3 species average_bill_lenth average_bill_depth 1 Adelie 38.8 18.3 2 Chinstrap 48.8 18.4 3 Gentoo 47.6 15.0 ``` ::: ::: When we knit this up it looks like of ugly... # Using `kable` to get pretty tables ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(kableExtra) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} penguins %>% group_by(species) %>% summarise(average_bill_length = mean(bill_length_mm), average_bill_depth = mean(bill_depth_mm)) %>% kbl() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
species average_bill_length average_bill_depth
Adelie 38.82397 18.34726
Chinstrap 48.83382 18.42059
Gentoo 47.56807 14.99664
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #OR table1 <- penguins %>% group_by(species) %>% summarise(average_bill_length = mean(bill_length_mm), average_bill_depth = mean(bill_depth_mm)) kbl(table1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
species average_bill_length average_bill_depth
Adelie 38.82397 18.34726
Chinstrap 48.83382 18.42059
Gentoo 47.56807 14.99664
````` ::: ::: # Options in kable We customize the content so it's displaying the information more clearly. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} table1 %>% kbl(col.names = c("Species", "Average Bill Length", "Average Bill Depth"), caption = "Average Bill Characteristics by Species", digits = 2) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Average Bill Characteristics by Species
Species Average Bill Length Average Bill Depth
Adelie 38.82 18.35
Chinstrap 48.83 18.42
Gentoo 47.57 15.00
````` ::: ::: Better... # pretty styling ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} table1 %>% kbl(col.names = c("Species", "Average Bill Length", "Average Bill Depth"), caption = "Average Bill Characteristics by Species", digits = 2) %>% kable_styling() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Average Bill Characteristics by Species
Species Average Bill Length Average Bill Depth
Adelie 38.82 18.35
Chinstrap 48.83 18.42
Gentoo 47.57 15.00
````` ::: ::: Many options for customizing the look of the tables -- more here: Let's try one... Let's make each row's color correspond to ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} table1 %>% kbl(col.names = c("Species", "Average Bill Length", "Average Bill Depth"), caption = "Average Bill Characteristics by Species", digits = 2) %>% kable_paper() %>% column_spec(1, bold=T) %>% row_spec(2, color = "#c85bcc") %>% row_spec(3, color = "#067176") %>% row_spec(1, color = "#ff7501") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Average Bill Characteristics by Species
Species Average Bill Length Average Bill Depth
Adelie 38.82 18.35
Chinstrap 48.83 18.42
Gentoo 47.57 15.00
````` ::: ::: RStudio hosts a table contest every year! - Here is a link to this year's contest - Here is a link to previous year's entries and winners to explore what is possible! ::: callout-tip As a general rule, you should have the content of the table as you'd like it (the exact columns and rows you want) first and *then* you can make it pretty using the `kableExtra` package. :::
